problemStatement.formal: Formalize the three major barriers to proving P ≠ NP: Relativization, Natural Proofs, and Algebrization
problemStatement.plain: The P vs NP problem cannot be solved by techniques that relativize (Baker-Gill-Solovay 1975), by natural proofs assuming OWFs exist (Razborov-Rudich 1997), or by techniques that algebrize (Aaronson-Wigderson 2009).
whyMatters: Explains why P vs NP is hard

proven: P^A ⊆ NP^A for any oracle A (full 40-line proof)
Relativization barrier - cannot prove P=NP or P≠NP by relativizing
Natural proofs break crypto - contradict OWFs
P ⊆ NP ⊆ PSPACE ⊆ EXP containment chain
At least one containment is strict (from time hierarchy)
P = NP implies PH collapse to P
open: Oracle construction for P^A = NP^A (Baker-Gill-Solovay Part 1)
Oracle construction for P^A ≠ NP^A (Baker-Gill-Solovay Part 2)
knownResults.goal: Formalize barrier theorems and their implications

currentState.focus: Extended with PSPACE, EXP, polynomial hierarchy, NP-completeness

knowledge.progressSummary: 876-line file formalizing all three barriers. Proved P^A ⊆ NP^A, relativization barriers, P ⊆ NP ⊆ PSPACE ⊆ EXP chain, PH collapse theorem, NP-completeness framework with Cook-Levin.

insights: Mathlib has TM0/TM1/TM2 and TM2ComputableInPolyTime but no oracle TMs
Abstract oracle model sufficient for barrier theorems
LeanMillenniumPrizeProblems project uses Primcodable with FinEncoding
Community suggests L (lambda calculus) model may be easier than TMs
nextSteps: Add coNP and explore NP ∩ coNP

approaches.name: Abstract oracle model + consequences
approaches.hypothesis: Can formalize barriers without full TM infrastructure
approaches.strategy: Abstract oracle as function, prove relativization consequences
risks: Missing Mathlib TM infrastructure for full proofs

papers: Baker-Gill-Solovay (1975) - Relativizations of the P=?NP Question
